Use hand sanitizers: Hand sanitizers can be used to clean hands and kill germs. They are widely available and can be used as an alternative to soap.
Use wet wipes: Wet wipes can be used to clean the skin and remove dirt and grime. They are convenient and portable, making them a great option for on-the-go cleaning.
Use baking soda and water: Baking soda and water can be used to create a paste that can be used to clean the skin. It is gentle and effective at removing dirt and grime.
Use essential oils: Essential oils such as tea tree oil and lavender oil can be used to clean the skin and kill germs. They are natural and safe to use.

Use a waterless shower: A waterless shower can be used to clean the body without using soap. It is a great option for those who want to avoid the mundane task of washing their hands and body with soap every day.
